abstract: Carl C. Icahn is at it again. The billionaire investor has set his activist sights on two new targets, building stakes in the companies because he believes the shares are undervalued. Mr. Icahn now has a 14.57 percent stake in WCI Communities, a developer of housing in Florida, and has increased his holdings in Telik, an unprofitable developer of cancer and diabetes drugs, to 9.92 percent.
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn is at it again. The billionaire investor has set his activist sights on two new targets, building stakes in the companies because he believes the shares are undervalued. Mr. Icahn now has a 14.57 percent stake in WCI Communities, a developer of housing in Florida, and has increased his holdings in Telik, an unprofitable developer of cancer and diabetes drugs, to 9.92 percent.

headline.main: Icahn Takes Aim at Drug and Housing Companies
